model_solution:
Step 1: A vector is a possible direction vector for the line if it is parallel to the line.
The slope of the line is the ratio of the vertical change to the horizontal change of any point on the line.
Step 2:  A vector is parallel to the line if its slope is equal to the slope of the line.
The slope of the line is $-\frac{7}{4}.$
steps:
Step 1: A vector is a possible direction vector for the line if it is parallel to the line.
The slope of the line is the ratio of the vertical change to the horizontal change of any point on the line.

Step 2:  A vector is parallel to the line if its slope is equal to the slope of the line.
The slope of the line is $-\frac{7}{4}.$
full_steps:
Step 1: A vector is a possible direction vector for the line if it is parallel to the line.
The slope of the line is the ratio of the vertical change to the horizontal change of any point on the line.

Step 2:  A vector is parallel to the line if its slope is equal to the slope of the line.
The slope of the line is $-\frac{7}{4}.$
